docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: She was 14 when she became pregnant. She told her mother, and her mother called the clinic to set up an abortion. That was where the law came in, about the same time as the morning sickness. A bundle of nausea, anger and fear, she went to the same state court that handles juvenile delinquents, with braces on her teeth and a fullness in her womb.

headline.main: COURTS DEBATE JUDGES' ROLE WHEN GIRLS SEEK ABORTIONS
